title: What symbols can I use in a tattoo? - Quora

response.answer_text: Assuming you are not a preschool teacher who aspires to sport a tattoo of an erect cartoon penis on your forehead, I may suggest you the following tattoos that you can use. A cool Swastika with a red background.The Golden Arches of McDonaldsCool asian symbols like	Japanese 雌犬      Korean 김치      Chinese  炒饭 The good ol’ confederate flag.or perhaps, the title of any cool N.W.A. songs…I d suggest Track number 2 of STRAIGHT OUTTA COMPTON (1988). I mean, who would go wrong with that classic album ?In case you havent noticed, I was being sarcastic…steer clear from all that I said for the good of yourself. Need any inspiration for tattoos go check out this site called TattooBlend I am not going to post the link, because Quora can sometimes flag it or whatever. Cheers

What ever the hell you want! It's YOUR skin. It's YOUR body. Nobody has got to look at it but YOU. If they dont like it they can look away. Don't let anyone tell you that YOU can't, or shouldn't, HAVE that on YOUR body. I don't give a rats ass if it's offensive to any certain group of people. They need to get over it. It's freedom & this world needs to get over tryng to control everyone. But just remember if you put it out there for everyone to see, be shocked by or even disgusted by it you have to give the SAME RIGHTS TO EVERYONE ELSE. None of this “calling the kettle black”. It's an old term look it up. As for certain symbols I've found that Symbols.com is very helpful * and this is has nothing to do with style or any of the other advice I've given on tattos in other posts.
